/ˌek.spɪˈreɪ.ʃən/) the situation in which something that lasts for a fixed length of time comes to an end or stops being in use: the expiry of a lease/visaexpiry date What is the expiry date of your credit card? (= What is the last date on which it can be used?)
OLD USE death: Date of his expiry was March 3, 1931.
More examplesFewer examplesThe amount becomes payable on expiry of the 12-week notice period. The expiry of a patent is a great challenge for a drug company.The lease has five years to run until expiry.The option can be exercised on any day on or before expiry.They wanted to renegotiate the contract ahead of its expiry.The vouchers do have expiry dates, so make sure you use them in time.

the end of an agreement or a document after a fixed length of time: the expiry of sth The restrictions must apply for not more than two years beyond the expiry of any relevant employment contract. patent/contract/lease expiry
FINANCE, STOCK MARKET the end of the period of time during which an option (= the right to buy or sell particular shares) can be exercised (= used): Friday sees the expiry of the March options series. a futures/options expiry
